column4: how would i go back to a older kernel version if the new one wont let me boot ?
you might boot from live cd and then mount your hard drive and move the bad kernel out and put the new one in
i tryed that.. the new kernel is the bad one .. and when i boot from when i did that it comes up with the blue screen debien error where it has you need to load the kernel first .. press enter
do you know the location of the "good" kernel
yeah.. its in the same dir as the other one
IIRC you should be able to just issue the command boot /dev/slice/kernel
You "should" be able to tell the loader where your kernel is but if you boot from live ccd you can just mount the drive and go move the file
how will grub know that to use the older kernel ?
If you have grub setup then you dont need to go through all these hoops man
aaa  so it should auto detect the other images ?
you should be able to press esc or shift while its booting up to get the grub menu
aaa thanks.. i didnt know about the holding shift down..
right on! you should be able to get fixed up from there w/e got screwed up
thanks for your help..   its working now..
